intro: Pelargonium aconitophyllum var. angustisectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geranium, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It features upright stems with opposite, lanceolate leaves that are finely toothed and have a dark green, glossy appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
